item.name: Auth

request.description:
## Description

This endpoint is used to sign up a new user. The request should be sent as an HTTP POST to [http://localhost:5000/api/auth/signup](http://localhost:5000/api/auth/signup) with a JSON payload in the raw request body.

## Request

The payload should include the user's fullname, username, email, password, and type.

## Auth Login

This endpoint allows users to log in and obtain an access token for accessing protected resources.

### Request Body

- `email` (string): The email address of the user.
- `pass` (string): The password of the user.
- `type` (string): The type of authentication.
    

### Response

- `access_token` (string): The token used to access protected resources.
- `token_type` (string): The type of token.
- `expires_in` (integer): The duration of the access token's validity.
This endpoint is used to clear refresh-token from httpOnly cookie.

This endpoint is used to refresh the access token by providing the refresh token in the request body.

### Request Body

- The request body is empty. The refresh_token is sent in the header.
    

### Response

- access_token (string): The new access token.
- token_type (string): Type of token, e.g., "bearer".
- expires_in (integer): Time in seconds until the token expires.

This endpoint is used to let admin approve the registration of a new problem setter.

### Request Body

- The request body is empty. The Id of the problem setter is sent as parameter in the url.
    

### Response

- Upon successful execution the response is is returned with status code 204 and an empty body.

This endpoint is used to let the user request for a authorization token if he forgets the password.

### Request Body

- The request body has the email and the type of the user.
    

### Response

- Upon successful execution the response is is returned with status code 204 and an empty body.

This endpoint is used to let the user reset his password using the authorization token.

### Request Body

- The request body has the authorization token and the new password of the user.
    

### Response

- Upon successful execution the response is is returned with status code 204 and an empty body.

This endpoint is used to let the user change his password .

### Request Body

- The request body has the current password and the new password of the user.
    

### Response

- Upon successful execution the response is is returned with status code 204 and an empty body.

This endpoint is used to let the user delete his own account.

### Request Body

- The request body is empty.
    

### Response

- Upon successful execution the response is is returned with status code 204 and an empty body.

item.description:
The Authentication and Authorization API provides endpoints to manage  
user authentication and authorization within the system. These endpoints  
facilitate secure access to protected resources, ensuring proper  
verification of user identity and permissions.

item.name: Topic

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new topic by making an HTTP POST request to the specified URL. The request should include a JSON payload in the raw request body type with the keys "name", "description", and "logo". The values for these keys should be provided accordingly to create the new topic.

### Request Body

- `name`: (string) The name of the topic.
- `description`: (string) A description of the topic.
- `logo`: (string) The URL or file path for the topic's logo.

# Get Topic Details

This endpoint retrieves details for a specific topic.

## Request

The request does not require any payload in the request body.

## Response

The response will contain an object, which represents the topic. The topic object includes the following properties:

- "topic_id": (number) The unique identifier for the topic.
    
- "name": (string) The name of the topic.
    
- "description": (string) The description of the topic. This may be null if no description is available.
    
- "logo": (string) The URL for the logo associated with the topic.

This endpoint allows you to update the details of a specific topic using an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL.

### Request Body

The request should include a payload with the raw request body type containing the updated information for the topic, such as the name, description, and logo.

### Response

Upon a successful update, the endpoint returns a status code of 204 with an empty array as the response body.

This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to delete the topic with the given ID .

### Request

The request does not require any payload in the raw request body.

### Response

- Status: 204
This endpoint used to let the admin approve a newly added topic so that the users can view it.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of topics. The response includes an array of objects, where each object represents a topic with its ID, name, description, and logo URL. The "topic_id" is a unique identifier for each topic, "name" represents the name of the topic, "description" provides a brief description of the topic, and "logo" contains the URL of the topic's logo image.

This HTTP GET request is used to retrieve a list of live topics from the API. The request does not require a request body. The response will include an array of objects, where each object represents a topic with its ID, name, description, and logo URL. The "name" field represents the name of the topic, the "description" field provides a brief description of the topic, and the "logo" field contains the URL of the topic's logo image.

item.description:
The Topics API provides a set of endpoints to manage topics within the  
system. Topics represent distinct subjects or categories that users can  
interact with. These endpoints facilitate the retrieval, creation,  
modification, and deletion of topics.

item.name: Series

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP POST request to create a new series via the API.

#### Request

The request should include a payload with the following parameters in raw JSON format:

- `topic_id` (number): The ID of the topic associated with the series.
- `canvas_id` (number): The ID of the canvas associated with the series.
- `name` (string): The name of the series.
- `description` (string, optional): The description of the series.
- `logo` (string): The logo of the series.
- `template` (string): The template for the series.
    

#### Response

Upon successful creation, the endpoint returns a status code of 201 with an empty array as the response.

body.raw:
{
    "topic_id": 2,
    "canvas_id": 2,
    "name": "Tower Of Hanoi",
    "description": null,
    "logo": "https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSbAENY_duGomNEm95iTrLS6t6phHPiZ0pSAbgIwhXTOYCcIvfcj1z6QiSeM_PQblTkfoU&usqp=CAU",
    "template": "/**
 *
 * @param {Object} data - An object containing pegs and disks.
 * @param {Array} data.pegs - Array of list of disks.
 * @returns {boolean} True if the solution is valid, otherwise false.
 */
function solutionChecker(data) {
  return false;
}
"
}

request.description: This HTTP GET request is used to retrieve information about a specific series with the given ID. The response will include details such as series ID, topic ID, canvas ID, name, description, logo, and template associated with the series. ### Request The request does not include a request body as it is a GET request and the series ID is included in the URL path parameter. - [Endpoint:http://localhost:5000/api/series/:series_id](http://localhost:5000/api/series/:series) - Method: `GET` ### Response The response will have a status code of 200 and will contain an series object, which represents a series with its associated details. The details include: - `series_id`: The unique identifier for the series. - `topic_id`: The identifier for the topic associated with the series. - `canvas_id`: The identifier for the canvas associated with the series. - `name`: The name of the series. - `description`: The description of the series. - `logo`: The URL for the logo associated with the series. - `template`: The template or code snippet associated with the series.

response.name: GetSeries

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP PUT request to update a specific series with the provided ID. The request should include a payload with the series details in the raw request body. The response will have a status code of 200 and an empty array as the data.

### Request Body

- series (object)
    - topic_id (number): The ID of the topic associated with the series.
    - canvas_id (number): The ID of the canvas associated with the series.
    - name (string): The name of the series.
    - description (string): The description of the series.
    - logo (string): The URL or path to the series logo image.
    - template (string): The template used for the series.

### Response

- Status: 204
    
- Data: No data

This endpoint is used to delete a specific series with the given ID. The request does not contain a request body. Upon successful execution, the response will return a status code of 200 and an empty array as the response body.
This endpoint used to let the admin approve a newly added series so that the users can view it.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of series from the API. The request does not require a request body. ### Request The request does not include a request body as it is a GET request and the series ID is included in the URL path parameter. - [Endpoint:http://localhost:5000/api/series/](http://localhost:5000/api/series/:series) - Method: `GET` ### Response The response will have a status code of 200 and will contain an array of objects, where each object represents a series with its associated details. The details include: - `series_id`: The unique identifier for the series. - `topic_id`: The identifier for the topic associated with the series. - `canvas_id`: The identifier for the canvas associated with the series. - `name`: The name of the series. - `description`: The description of the series. - `logo`: The URL for the logo associated with the series. - `template`: The template or code snippet associated with the series.

response.name: GetAllSeries

request.description: This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of live series from the API. The request does not require a request body. ### Request The request does not include a request body as it is a GET request and the series ID is included in the URL path parameter. - [Endpoint:http://localhost:5000/api/series/live](http://localhost:5000/api/series/:series) - Method: `GET` ### Response The response will have a status code of 200 and will contain an array of objects, where each object represents a series with its associated details. The details include: - `series_id`: The unique identifier for the series. - `topic_id`: The identifier for the topic associated with the series. - `canvas_id`: The identifier for the canvas associated with the series. - `name`: The name of the series. - `description`: The description of the series. - `logo`: The URL for the logo associated with the series. - `template`: The template or code snippet associated with the series.

item.description:
The Series API provides a set of endpoints to manage Serieses within the  
system. Series represent distinct subjects or categories of problems under a topic that users can  
interact with. These endpoints facilitate the retrieval, creation,  
modification, and deletion of Serieses.

item.name: Canvas

request.description:
The `POST /api/canvas/` endpoint allows you to create a new canvas. The request should include a JSON payload with parameters such as `name`, `classname`, `info`, `logo`, `params`, `control_params`, `ui_params`, and `template`. The response will contain the newly created `canvas_id`.

### Request Body

- `name` (string): The name of the canvas.
- `classname` (string): The class name of the canvas.
- `info` (string): Additional information about the canvas.
- `logo` (string): The logo of the canvas.
- `params` (object): Parameters for the canvas.
- `control_params` (object): Control parameters for the canvas.
- `ui_params` (object): UI parameters for the canvas.
- `template` (string): The template for the canvas.
    

### Response

Upon successful creation, the response will include the `canvas_id` of the newly created canvas.

This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve information about a specific canvas .

### Response

The response contains details about the canvas, including its name, class name, information, logo, parameters, control parameters, UI parameters, and a template for solution checking.

response.name: GetCanvas

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to update the canvas with the specified ID. The request should be sent as an HTTP PUT to [http://localhost:5000/api/canvas/6](http://localhost:5000/api/canvas/6)

### Request

There will be the updated info about the canvas as payload in the raw request body

This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to [http://localhost:5000/api/canvas/8](http://localhost:5000/api/canvas/8) to delete a specific canvas.

### Request

The request does not include a request body.
This endpoint used to let the admin approve a newly added canvas so that the users can view it.

This endpoint retrieves a list of canvas items.

### Request

- Payload: null
    

### Response

- Status: 200
- Body : The response will provide detailed information about each canvas, including its unique identifier, canvas data, UI parameters, control parameters.

response.name: GetAllCanvas

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves a list of live canvas items.

### Request

- Payload: null
    

### Response

- Status: 200
- Body : The response will provide detailed information about each canvas, including its unique identifier, canvas data, UI parameters, control parameters.

response.name: GetLiveCanvas

item.description:
The Canvas API provides a set of endpoints to manage Canvases within the  
system. Canvas represent the unique interfaces which the problem setters will use to design visual problems and the users can interact with to solve the problems. These endpoints facilitate the retrieval, creation,modification, and deletion of Canvases.

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the profile information.

### Request

The request does not require any parameters or request body.

### Response

The response returns a status code of 200 along with an array of profile information. The profile information includes user_id, fullname, username, image, date of birth (dob), and is_public status.

This endpoint allows you to create a new profile by sending a POST request to the specified URL.

### Request

The request should include a JSON payload in the raw request body, containing the profile details such as fullname, username, image, date of birth (dob), and a flag indicating if the profile is public (is_public).

### Response

Upon successful execution, the API returns a status code of 204 with an empty response body.

This endpoint allows you to update a user's profile. The HTTP PUT request should be made to [http://localhost:5000/api/profile](http://localhost:5000/api/profile).

### Request Body

- `user_id` (number) - The ID of the user.
- `fullname` (string) - The full name of the user.
- `username` (string) - The username of the user.
- `image` (string) - The URL of the user's profile image.
- `dob` (date) - The date of birth of the user.
- `is_public` (boolean) - Indicates whether the user's profile is public or not.
    

### Response

The response for this request will have a status code of 200, indicating a successful update. The response body will be an empty array \[\].

This API endpoint allows users to upload a profile. The HTTP POST request should be sent to [http://localhost:5000/api/profile/upload/](http://localhost:5000/api/profile/upload/). The request should have a form-data file to be uploaded.

Upon successful execution, the API returns a status code of 200 with a null response.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of user profiles. The request does not require any payload in the request body.

The response will include an array of user profiles, where each profile object contains the user's ID, full name, username, profile image URL, date of birth, and a flag indicating whether the profile is public or not.

Example response:

``` json
[
    {
        "user_id": 16,
        "fullname": "Mahir Labib Dihan",
        "username": "dihan",
        "image": "https://preview.redd.it/tried-to-make-the-discord-clyde-logo-more-similar-to-the-v0-g2bha52fh9v91.png?auto=webp&s=f74e8a7068998d18b22fa3bbb3e62ee9975204d3",
        "dob": null,
        "is_public": null
    }
]

 ```

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of problem setters. The request does not require a request body. The response will include an array of objects, where each object represents a profile setter and includes their user ID, full name, username, image URL, date of birth, and a flag indicating whether the profile is public or not.

This HTTP GET request is used to fetch a list of recommended problem details. The response will include an array of objects, each containing information about a recommended problem. The details include problem ID, series ID, author ID, title, statement, canvas data, live status, last updated timestamp, checker code, parameters, UI parameters, control parameters, canvas ID, submit state ID, serial number, checker type, checker canvas, series name, and topic name.

response.name: GetRecomendation

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of problems from the server. The response will contain an array of objects, each representing a specific problem. Each problem object includes various attributes such as problem_id, series_id, author_id, title, statement, canvas_data, is_live, last_updated, checker_code, params, ui_params, control_params, canvas_id, submit_state_id, serial_no, checker_type, and checker_canvas. The status of the last execution was 200.

The response will provide detailed information about each problem, including its unique identifier, series, author, title, statement, canvas data, live status, update timestamp, code checker, parameters, UI parameters, control parameters, canvas identifier, submission state identifier, serial number, checker type, and checker canvas details.

response.name: GetAllProblems

request.description: This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of submitted problems. The response will include an array of objects, each representing a submitted problem. Each object contains various properties such as problem_id, series_id, author_id, title, statement, canvas_data, is_live, last_updated, checker_code, params, ui_params, control_params, canvas_id, submit_state_id, serial_no, checker_type, and checker_canvas. The status of the last execution was 200.

response.name: SubmittedProblems
AllBySeries

request.description: This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a problem by series ID. The response will include details of the problem, such as problem ID, series ID, author ID, title, statement, canvas data, live status, last updated timestamp, checker code, parameters, UI parameters, control parameters, canvas ID, submit state ID, serial number, checker type, checker canvas, series name, and topic name.

response.name: BySeries

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves a list of unsolved problems by series ID. It makes an HTTP GET request to the specified URL.

The response will include an array of objects, each representing a problem. Each problem object contains various attributes such as problem_id, series_id, author_id, title, statement, canvas_data, is_live, last_updated, checker_code, params, ui_params, control_params, canvas_id, submit_state_id, serial_no, checker_type, checker_canvas, series_name, and topic_name.

The response will also include detailed information about the problem, including the canvas data, parameters, UI parameters, control parameters, and checker canvas.

The last call to this request did not include a request body.

The last execution returned a status code of 200 along with the array of problem objects.

response.name: BySeriesUnsolved

request.description:
This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of problems based on a specific topic. The request should be made to [http://localhost:5000/api/problem/by_topic/2](http://localhost:5000/api/problem/by_topic/2).

The response will include a JSON array containing objects with information about each problem. Each object includes details such as problem ID, series ID, author ID, title, statement, canvas data, live status, last updated timestamp, checker code, parameters, UI parameters, control parameters, canvas ID, submit state ID, serial number, checker type, checker canvas, topic ID, name, description, and logo.

The response status for the last execution was 200.

response.name: ByTopic

request.description:
### Create a Problem

This API endpoint allows you to create a new problem.

#### Request Body

- `series_id` (integer): The ID of the series.
- `author_id` (integer): The ID of the author.
- `title` (string): The title of the problem.
- `statement` (string): The statement of the problem.
- `canvas_data` (object): Data related to the canvas including the number of moves, disks, pegs, and their configuration.
- `is_live` (boolean): Indicates if the problem is live.
- `last_updated` (string): Timestamp of the last update.
- `checker_code` (string): The checker code for the problem.
- `params` (object): Additional parameters for the problem.
- `ui_params` (object): UI parameters for the problem.
- `control_params` (object): Control parameters for the problem.
- `canvas_id` (integer): The ID of the canvas.
- `submit_state_id` (integer): The ID of the submit state.
- `serial_no` (integer): The serial number.
- `checker_type` (integer): The type of the checker.
- `checker_canvas` (object): Data related to the checker canvas including the number of moves, disks, pegs, and their configuration.
    

#### Response

Upon successful creation, the API returns the ID of the newly created problem.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve details of a specific problem with the given ID .

### Response

The response will be a JSON array containing the details of the problem, including its ID, series ID, author ID, title, statement, canvas data, and various parameters related to the problem. The response will also include control parameters specific to the canvas.

response.name: GetProblemById

request.description:
### Delete Problem

This endpoint is used to delete a specific problem with the given ID.

#### Request Parameters

- No request body parameters are required for this request.
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
- Data: An empty array is returned upon successful deletion.

This endpoint allows updating the title of a specific problem by sending an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL. The request should include a JSON payload with the new title in the raw request body. The response will have a status code of 200 and an empty array as the data.

### Request Body

- title (string, required): The new title for the problem.
    

### Response

- Status: 200
- Data: An empty array

This HTTP PUT request is used to update a specific series within a problem via the '/api/problem/68/series' endpoint. The request should include a payload with the 'series_id' field to specify the series to be updated.

### Request Body

- series_id (string, required): The ID of the series to be updated.
    

### Response

- Status: 200
- Data: An array representing the updated series.

This API endpoint allows you to update the serial number for a specific problem with the given ID.

### Request Body

- `serial_no` (string, required): The new serial number to be updated.
    

### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Data: An empty array is returned upon successful update.

This endpoint allows you to update the canvas for a specific problem using an HTTP PUT request. The request should be sent to [http://localhost:5000/api/problem/68/canvas](http://localhost:5000/api/problem/68/canvas).

### Request

The request payload should be in raw format and include the following parameters:

- canvas_id (numeric): The ID of the canvas.
- canvas_data (object): An object containing data related to the canvas, such as the number of moves, disks, and pegs.
- params (object): Additional parameters for customization, such as custom_disk and ordered.
- control_params (object): Control parameters for the canvas.
- ui_params (object): User interface parameters, including moves, n_disks, custom_disk, and undo.
    

### Response

The response to this request will have a status code of 200, and the body will be an empty array (\[\]).

This endpoint allows you to update the statement for a specific problem using an HTTP PUT request. The request should be sent to [http://localhost:5000/api/problem/68/statement](http://localhost:5000/api/problem/68/statement).

#### Request

- The request body should be in raw format and include a JSON object with the "statement" key.
    

#### Response

- The response will have a status code of 200 and an empty array as the data.

This endpoint allows you to update the solution checker for a specific problem by sending an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL. The request should include the solution checker and the checker type in the raw request body.

### Request Body

- solution_checker (string): The solution checker for the problem. This can be a code or a canvas to match with.
    
- checker_type (string): The type of the checker("0" : code , "1": canvas).
    

### Response

The endpoint returns a status code of 200 with an empty array as the response body.

This API endpoint allows users to submit a problem . The HTTP POST request should be made to [http://localhost:5000/api/problem/:problem_id/submit](http://localhost:5000/api/problem/111/submit).

### Request

The request body should be empty.

### Response

- Status: 204

This endpoint is used to publish a specific problem . The request should be sent via an HTTP POST method to the specified URL.

### Request

The request body for this endpoint has an undefined type and no specific payload was provided in the last call.

### Response

- Status: 200
- The response is an empty array "\[\]".

This endpoint makes an HTTP POST request to [http://localhost:5000/api/problem/111/unpublish](http://localhost:5000/api/problem/111/unpublish) in order to unpublish a specific problem.

### Request

The request does not contain a request body.

### Response

- Status: 200
- Example: \[\]

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of unsolved problems. The response will include an array of objects, each representing an unsolved problem with various attributes such as problem_id, series_id, author_id, title, statement, canvas_data, is_live, last_updated, checker_code, params, ui_params, control_params, canvas_id, submit_state_id, serial_no, checker_type, checker_canvas, series_name, and topic_name.

response.name: GetUnsolved

This endpoint retrieves a list of unsolved problems that have been attempted.

#### Request

- Method: GET
- URL: `http://localhost:5000/api/problem/unsolved/attempted`
- Payload: null
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- The response contains an array of problem objects with their respective attributes.

request.description:
### Add Bookmark to Problem

This endpoint allows the user to add a bookmark to a specific problem.

**HTTP Request**  
`POST http://localhost:5000/api/problem/68/bookmark`

**Response**

- Status: 200
- Body: null
This endpoint is used to let the admin update rattings of all problem based on user stats.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the users submission data for a specific problem ID.

### Endpoint

`GET http://localhost:5000/api/submission/:problem_id`

### Request Body

The request does not contain a request body.

### Response

The response contains submission data, where the object includes the following fields:

- `submission_id` (number): The ID of the submission
- `problem_id` (number): The ID of the problem
- `user_id` (number): The ID of the user
- `verdict` (string): The verdict of the submission
- `time_stamp` (string): The timestamp of the submission
- `json_data` (object): Additional JSON data related to the canvas.

# Get All Users Submission Data

This endpoint retrieves the submission data for all users related to a specific problem ID.

### Endpoint

`GET http://localhost:5000/api/submission/:problem_id/allUsers`

### Request Body

The request does not contain a request body.

## Response

### Status: 200

The response contains an array of submission data, where each object includes the following fields:

- `submission_id` (number): The ID of the submission
- `problem_id` (number): The ID of the problem
- `user_id` (number): The ID of the user
- `verdict` (string): The verdict of the submission
- `time_stamp` (string): The timestamp of the submission
- `json_data` (object): Additional JSON data related to the canvas.

## Save Submission

This endpoint allows the user to save a submission with the provided data.

### Request Body

- user_id (integer): The ID of the user submitting the data.
- verdict (string): The verdict of the submission.
- time_stamp (string): The timestamp of the submission.
- json_data (object): The JSON data containing canvas information.
    

### Response

- submission_id (integer): The ID of the saved submission.

### Get Submission Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a submission.

**Request**:

- Method: GET
- URL: `http://localhost:5000/api/submission/`
    

**Response**:

- Status: 200
    
- The response contains an array of submission data, where each object includes the following fields:
    
    - `submission_id` (number): The ID of the submission
        
    - `problem_id` (number): The ID of the problem
        
    - `user_id` (number): The ID of the user
        
    - `verdict` (string): The verdict of the submission
        
    - `time_stamp` (string): The timestamp of the submission
        
    - `json_data` (object): Additional JSON data related to the canvas.

This HTTP GET request retrieves the statistics for failed attempts in a series. The request should be sent to [http://localhost:5000/api/userActivity/stat/seriesFails](http://localhost:5000/api/userActivity/stat/seriesFails).

The response will include a status code of 200, along with an array of objects containing the series ID, name, and the total number of failed attempts per series.

This endpoint sends an HTTP GET request to retrieve the statistics for successful series attempts by users. The request does not contain a request body. 

The response returns a status code of 200 along with an array of objects, each containing the series ID, name, and the total number of successful attempts for each series.

This endpoint retrieves the statistics of failed user activity for a specific series. It makes an HTTP GET request to the specified URL with the series ID as a path parameter. The response will include an array of objects containing the series ID, name, and the total number of failed attempts for each series.

The last call to this request did not include a request body. The response had a status code of 200 and returned an array with objects containing the series ID, name, and the total failed attempts per series.

This endpoint retrieves the statistics for successful user activity for a specific user. It makes an HTTP GET request to the specified URL to fetch the statistics for the user's successful attempts.

The request does not contain a request body, and the parameters are included in the URL itself. The "2" in the URL represents the user ID for which the statistics are being fetched.

The response to the request is a status code 200, and it returns an array of objects containing the series ID, name, and the total number of successful attempts for each series.

This endpoint retrieves the user's successful activity statistics. It makes an HTTP GET request to fetch the total successful attempts per series for the current user.

The response will include an array of objects, each containing the series ID, name, and the total successful attempts per series.

This endpoint retrieves the statistics of failed user activity for a specific user.

The response will contain an array of objects, where each object represents a series of user activity and includes the series ID, name, and the total number of failed attempts for that series.

item.name: Contest

request.description:
This HTTP GET request fetches a list of contests available in the API. The request does not require any payload in the request body.

### Response

The response will have a status code of 200, indicating a successful request. The body of the response will be an array of objects, with each object representing a contest. Each contest object contains the following attributes:

- `contest_id`: The unique identifier for the contest.
- `title`: The title of the contest.
- `description`: A brief description of the contest.
- `start_date`: The start date of the contest.
- `end_date`: The end date of the contest.
- `status`: The status of the contest (e.g., "edit", "upcoming","running","completed").
    
- `last_updated`: The timestamp of the last update to the contest.

request.description: This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of contests owned by the user. The request does not include a request body. The response will have a status code of 200, and it will contain an array of contest objects. Each contest object includes the contest ID, title, description, start date, end date, status, last updated timestamp, and role information.
Upon successful execution, the response will have a status code of 201 and will include the ID of the newly created contest in the format \[{"contest_id": 0}\].

### Request Body

The payload should include the new title for the contest.

### Response

Upon a successful update, the endpoint returns a status code of 204

### Request Body

- description (string, required): The new description for the contest.
    

### Response

- Status: 204

This endpoint allows you to add a collaborator to a specific contest.

### Request Body

- `collaborator_id` (string, required): The ID of the collaborator to be added.
    

### Response

- Status: 204

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of all collaborators for a specific contest.

### Request

The request does not require any payload.

- HTTP Method: GET
- URL: [http://localhost:5000/api/contest/:contest_id/showAllCollaborators/](http://localhost:5000/api/contest/3/showAllCollaborators/)
    

### Response

The response will have a status code of 200 and will contain an array of objects, where each object represents a collaborator and includes the following properties:

- contest_setter_id (number): The ID of the contest setter
- contest_id (number): The ID of the contest
- setter_id (number): The ID of the collaborator
- role (string): The role of the author in the contest

### Response

- Status: 204

request.description:
# Get Contest Submissions

This endpoint retrieves the submissions for the authenticated user in a specific contest.

## Request

### Endpoint

`GET http://localhost:5000/api/contest/1/submissions/me/`

## Response

- Status: 200 OK
    

The response will contain an array of submission objects, each containing the following attributes:

- `participation_id` (integer): The ID of the participation.
- `contest_id` (integer): The ID of the contest.
- `problem_id` (integer): The ID of the problem.
- `user_id` (integer): The ID of the user.
- `submission_id` (integer): The ID of the submission.
- `points` (null): The points earned for the submission.
- `verdict` (string): The verdict of the submission.
- `time_stamp` (string): The timestamp of the submission.
- `json_data` (null): Additional JSON data related to the submission.

request.description:
This endpoint is used to start a contest with the ID 3. The HTTP PUT request should be made to [http://localhost:5000/api/contest/3/start/](http://localhost:5000/api/contest/3/start/).

The request does not require a request body, as indicated by the null payload.

Upon a successful execution, the API returns a status code of 200 with an empty array \[\] as the response.

This endpoint is used to end a specific contest by sending an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL. The request does not require a request body. Upon a successful execution, the endpoint returns a 200 status code with an empty array in the response.

### Request Body

- problem_id (string, required): The ID of the problem to be deleted from the contest.
    

### Response

- Status: 204

This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to delete a contest with the ID of 2. The request does not contain a request body. Upon successful execution, the server responds with a status code of 204 and an empty array as the response body.

This endpoint allows users to participate in a live contest by making an HTTP POST request to {{base_url}}/contest/:contest_id/participate/live.

### Request Body

The request should include a payload in the raw request body type.

### Response

Upon a successful execution, the API returns a status code of 200 with an empty array as the response body.

This endpoint allows users to participate in a virtual contest by sending an HTTP POST request to the specified URL. The request body for this endpoint is empty.

### Response

- Status: 200

This endpoint retrieves the list of live participants for the contest with ID 3. The request does not require a request body.

The response to the request returns a status code of 200, along with an array of participant objects. Each participant object includes the user's ID, full name, username, image, date of birth, and a flag indicating whether the user's profile is public or not.

This endpoint retrieves the participants for a virtual contest with ID 4. The request does not require a request body. The response will include an array of participant objects, each containing user ID, full name, username, image, date of birth, and a flag indicating whether the user's profile is public.

This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to leave a live contest with the ID 3. The request does not contain a request body. Upon successful execution, the endpoint returns a 200 status code with an empty array as the response.

The response returns a status code of 200 and an empty array "\[\]".

The response returns a status code of 200 along with an array of contest objects. Each contest object includes the following properties:

- `contest_id` (number): The unique identifier for the contest.
- `title` (string): The title of the contest.
- `description` (string): A brief description of the contest.
- `start_date` (string): The start date of the contest.
- `end_date` (string): The end date of the contest.
- `status` (string): The status of the contest.
- `last_updated` (string): The date and time when the contest details were last updated.

Upon successful execution, the API will respond with a status code of 200 and a JSON array containing the "clarification_id" for the added clarification.
